Step 4: Heatmap of top ligand–receptor (LR) pairs using pheatmap

Source: R/run_ChimeHeatmap.R
run_ChimeHeatmap.Rd

Selects top LR pairs from statistical results and plots a pair (rows) × sample (columns) heatmap of LR scores.

Usage

run_ChimeHeatmap(
  lr_scores,
  stat_results,
  n_top = 20,
  fdr_thr = 0.05,
  pair_column = c("pair", "pair_human"),
  sample_order = c(paste0("Control_", 1:3), paste0("Treatment_", 1:3)),
  cluster_rows = TRUE,
  cluster_cols = FALSE,
  scale_rows = TRUE,
  palette = "RdBu",
  palette_n = 100,
  palette_rev = TRUE,
  breaks = NULL,
  fontsize_row = 12,
  fontsize_col = 12,
  border_color = "white",
  show_rownames = TRUE,
  ...
)

Arguments

lr_scores

Data frame from get_ChimeLRscore().

stat_results

Data frame from get_ChimeStatistics() (must contain pair, p.adj, t, and delta).

n_top

Integer. Number of top pairs to plot (default 20).

fdr_thr

Numeric. FDR threshold used to prefer significant pairs (default 0.05).

pair_column

Which LR-pair column in lr_scores to use: "pair" (display) or "pair_human" (both sides in human symbols).

sample_order

Character vector. Desired column order in the heatmap. Columns not listed will be appended after the specified order. Default: c(paste0("Control_", 1:3), paste0("Treatment_", 1:3)).

cluster_rows

Logical. Cluster rows? (default TRUE)

cluster_cols

Logical. Cluster columns? (default FALSE)

scale_rows

Logical. If TRUE, row-scale scores (i.e., scale="row") (default TRUE).

palette

Brewer palette name (default "RdBu").

palette_n

Integer. Number of colors to interpolate (default 100).

palette_rev

Logical. Reverse palette? (default TRUE).

breaks

Optional numeric vector of breaks passed to pheatmap. If NULL, symmetric breaks are computed; when scale_rows=TRUE, a centered scheme in [-2, 2] is used by default.

fontsize_row

Numeric. Row font size (default 12).

fontsize_col

Numeric. Column font size (default 12).

border_color

Border color (default "white").

show_rownames

Logical. Show row names? (default TRUE).

...

Additional arguments passed to pheatmap::pheatmap().

Value

A list with three elements:

  • pairs — Character vector of plotted pairs (in the order used).

  • matrix — Numeric matrix (pairs × samples) used for plotting.

  • plot — The pheatmap object (invisibly returned by pheatmap).

Details

Pair selection logic:

  1. If any pairs meet the FDR threshold, take the top n_top by ascending p.adj (ties broken by |t|).

  2. Else if any pairs have finite p.adj, take the top n_top by ascending p.adj.

  3. Else fall back to top n_top by descending |delta|.
